choices.D: Use the GRANT privilege ... TO SHARE command to grant the necessary privileges.
choices.B: Drop the object and then re-add it to the database to trigger sharing.
choices.A: Use the automatic sharing feature for seamless access.
choices.C: Recreate the object with a different name in the database before sharing.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To make a new object available to consumers, you must use the GRANT <privilege> … TO SHARE command to explicitly add the object to the share.

questions.question_text: What action should be taken if a Snowflake user wants to share a newly created object in a database with consumers?
Which Snowflake privilege is required on a pipe object to pause or resume pipes?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A non-owner role with the OPERATE privilege on the pipe can pause or resume a pipe (using ALTER PIPE … SET PIPE_EXECUTION_PAUSED = TRUE | FALSE).

SQL operations on schema objects also require the USAGE privilege on the database and schema that contain the object.

Selected Answer: AC
A clustering key can be defined at table creation (using the CREATE TABLE command) or afterward (using the ALTER TABLE command).

questions.question_text: Which commands can a Snowflake user execute to specify a cluster key for a table? (Choose two.)
Authorization to execute CREATE [object] statements comes only from which role?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Primary role
Note that authorization to execute CREATE <object> statements to create objects is provided by the primary role.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/use-secondary-roles

Selected Answer: A
Primary role is the correct answer

RETURN_ALL_ERRORS

Returns all errors across all files specified in the COPY statement, including files with errors that were partially loaded during an earlier load because the ON_ERROR copy option was set to CONTINUE during the load.
D

RETURN_ERRORS

Returns all errors (parsing, conversion, etc.) across all files specified in the COPY statement.

RETURN_ALL_ERRORS

Returns all errors across all files specified in the COPY statement, including files with errors that were partially loaded during an earlier load because the ON_ERROR copy option was set to CONTINUE during the load.

Selected Answer: D
D
RETURN_ALL_ERRORS
Returns all errors across all files specified in the COPY statement, including files with errors that were partially loaded during an earlier load because the ON_ERROR copy option was set to CONTINUE during the load.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/copy-into-table

comments.content: You mixed those two, should be the other way around! Be careful when replying as this is so misleading

discussion.content:
Should be C. 
 The VALIDATION_MODE=RETURN_ALL_ERRORS parameter returns all errors across all files specified in the copy command statement. VALIDATION_MODE=RETURN_ERRORS: Returns all errors across all files in the COPY command, including files that were partially loaded during an earlier load.

questions.question_text: Which VALIDATION_MODE value will return the errors across the files specified in a COPY command, including files that were partially loaded during an earlier load?
